type.description:
### ⚠️ Requires [Apugli](https://apugli.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) to be installed! ⚠️

## Player Model Type

---


[Entity Condition Type](https://apugli.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/player_model_type).

Check whether an `AbstractClientPlayerEntity` uses the `DEFAULT` or `SLIM` model type.

Type ID: `apugli:player_model_type`



---

### ⚠️ Caution

This condition is only effective client-side. That means any server-sided power types will not work as intended.



---

### Example
```json
"condition": {
    "type": "apugli:player_model_type",
    "model_type": "default"
}
```
This condition checks whether the `AbstractClientPlayerEntity` has a default (Steve) player model type.

x-intellij-html-description:
title: Player Model Type (Entity Condition Type) date: 2022-07-29

Player Model Type

Entity Condition Type.

Check whether an AbstractClientPlayerEntity uses the DEFAULT or SLIM model type.

Type ID: apugli:player_model_type

!!! caution

This condition is only effective client-side. That means any server-sided power types will not work as intended.

Fields

Field Type Default Description
model_type String The model type to check for. Can be either "default" OR "slim.

Example

"condition": {
    "type": "apugli:player_model_type",
    "model_type": "default"
}

This condition checks whether the AbstractClientPlayerEntity has a default (Steve) player model type.
